rule.name: DoNotUseThePrivateKeyword
rule.title: Do not use the 'private' keyword.
rule.message: Our coding convention is to leave out the private keyword and let it default to private.

rule.name: UseVarWherePossible
rule.title: Use the 'var' keyword instead of an explicit type where possible.
rule.message: The compiler is able to correctly identify which type to use here, so replace the explicit type with var.

rule.name: DoNotLeaveWhitespaceOnTheEndOfTheLine
rule.title: Do not leave whitespace on the end of the line.
rule.message: You have meaningless whitespace on the end of the line, remove it.
rule.description: Remove whitespace from the end of the line.

rule.name: IndentWithTabsRatherThanSpaces
rule.title: Indent with tabs rather than spaces.
rule.message: Our coding convention is to use tabs, not spaces, you may need to fix your settings.
rule.description: Replace the leading spaces with tabs.

rule.name: DoNotConfigureAwaitFromAsyncVoid
rule.title: Do not use ConfigureAwait from an async void method.
rule.message: ConfigureAwait(false) may result in the async method resuming on a non-deterministic thread, and if an exception is then thrown, it will likely be unhandled and result in process termination.
rule.description: Remove the ConfigureAwait call, or return Task.

rule.name: RemovedOrphanedSuppressions
rule.title: Remove orphaned suppressions.
rule.message: Encountered a code analysis suppression for the non-existent {targetKind} '{targetName}'. Remove or update it.
rule.description: If you change or remove a type or member that had a code analysis suppression against it, be sure to remove any orphaned suppression attributes. This is usually easier to maintain if the suppression attributes are applied directly to the type/member rather than applied to the assembly in a GlobalSuppressions.cs file.
